abstract: The effect of the introduction of in-situ formed Nb-based compounds on Al-including Mg alloys has been investigated. It is found that grain refinement is consistently achieved. Nb-based intermetallic particles are responsible of the effective heterogeneous nucleation of Al-including Mg alloys. The refining mechanism is discussed on the base of crystallography.

author_highlights.sentence: Refinement of Mg(-Al) grain structure is obtained via Nb-based compounds.
Grain refinement is consistently obtained also when using an Al-Nb-B master alloy.
Nb-based compounds act as stable heterogeneous nuclei to nucleate α-Mg grains.
Mg grains growth from the (0001) basal plane of NbB2 due to low lattice mismatch.
